mobs.keywords: blacksmith smith dwarf powerful dwarven man black ashes
mobs.long_desc: A powerful dwarf covered in ashes stands over the glowing embers of the forge.
mobs.desc: This middle-aged dwarf is clearly the blacksmith.  From his head to his feet he is covered with ash and sweat.  He is a bit larger then most dwarves.  His hands and forarms are thick from his work.  He must stay busy with the logging camp.  His beard is copper and tied into three thick braids.

mobs.keywords: Dwarven Peasant Dwarf Man Worker Lumberjack
mobs.long_desc: A dwarven peasant ignores you, focusing instead on his lumber.
mobs.desc: This dwarf apparels to be a master of his axe and seems quite capable of felling trees, as well as anything else that might meet his blade.  Dispite his stocky frame his raw power and stamina appear to make up for the difference in his work.

mobs.long_desc: A barbarian peasant glances at you, before returning to his task.
mobs.desc: This barbarian worker seems a bit smaller then you would expect at first glance, upon further inspection it is apparent that he is stooping to cut the base of the tree.  He must be a good 8 inches taller working that way must be bad on his big frame

mobs.long_desc: A peasant man works briskly here.
mobs.desc: This man is in peak health despite his age he looks to be in his late forties but could be younger.  But it's hard to tell with his short whiskers covering the better part of his face.  His arms gracefully bare the axe and hatchet as he works.

mobs.keywords: Dwarven Peasant Dwarf Boy Worker Lumberjack Apprentice
mobs.long_desc: A stocky young dwarven boy is hard at work.
mobs.desc: This boy is build powerfully.  Though short, weighs as much as any grown human here.  Filled with the strength of a dwarf and the energy of youth, this young apprentice excells at his new trade.  It is difficult to discern his age through his impressive beard.

mobs.long_desc: This boy is unusually large. He must be a barbarian peasant.
mobs.desc: The barbarian peasant boy is at least a foot taller than the human boys apprenticing here.  He certainly has the build of a mighty lumberjack, and the energy, but you can tell at once he is not yet fully comfortable with handling the tools of the trade, despite how naturally an axe may rest in his hands.

mobs.keywords: Human Peasant Boy Worker Lumberjack Apprentice
mobs.long_desc: A human peasant-boy is working here, learning the lumberjack trade.
mobs.desc: This young boy, in his mid-teens, is working hard to prove his worth as a worker.  Though he shows great skill on the site, he watches every move of the more experienced workers, doing his best to match their technique.

mobs.long_desc: Sven, the stable owner, is here tending to the animals.
mobs.desc: Sven is a leaky man, slender but strong.  He seems to be quite rough with the exception of his eyes.  He has the soft look and temperament of a man that works with animals.

mobs.long_desc: A large, sturdy-looking pack-mule is here idly between tasks.
mobs.desc: This large pack animal is well bred for hauling loads or stout riders.  It is almost certain that this one has been used for many years doing both.  The short light brown hair on it is fine and gives the beast an attractive look.

mobs.long_desc: Muleard stands here checking his inventory
mobs.desc: Muleard is a large older man he seems much older than every one else in this camp.  His bright blue eyes and gentle smile greet all who enter.  While he looks kind something tells you he doesn't call the guards to deal with thieves.

mobs.long_desc: A sturdy clydesdale stands here on wide hooves.
mobs.desc: A rather thick coat and large size protect this beast from the cold of northern climes.  The sturdy clydesdale is muscular and calm, and has easily- recognizable thick hooves.

mobs.long_desc: A very angry looking badger stands here.
mobs.desc: It is rather short animal with large paws and dark black legs built for digging.  Its long head is covered with black fur and distinctive white stripes.  Four large teeth protrude from its mouth and its small ears tucked back as if to suggest it ferocity.

mobs.long_desc: The blacksmith's nephew Doren is standing here.
mobs.desc: This dwarven youth looks well kempt like he recently bathed.  Though his clothes tell a separate story, There Weather worn and threadbare even but well mended and his clean face shows signs of his travels.  His stout body appears very fit.  And while not a warrior should be able to handed himself in a fight.

mobs.long_desc: a orc bandit covered in dark cloth stands here.
mobs.desc: This orc is covered in dark clothes, or at least what were clothes.  Blood stains are apparent on them, the dark reds and browns of human with the blacks and purples of orcs.  He looks repulsive in every way, a bit of ear is missing as is one of his fingers.  It's clear that he is a bandit of little skill but in executing ambushes, upon the unsuspecting and weak.

This large ox stands, with huge, sharp horns protruding from its head.  Its large brown eyes hold no trace of intelligence, though they are gentle.  Its coat of short greyish hair darkens near its four hooves.

mobs.long_desc: Tr'ven the fixer is standing behind his workbench.
mobs.desc: His black hair is groomed very well.  In fact, every thing from his tools to his clothes looks brand new.

mobs.long_desc: the Avatar of A'gad stands here.
mobs.desc: This guy does the FIRST HALF OF THE SKILLSETING the lesser imms wish they could do on their own.

mobs.long_desc: the Avatar of H'var stands here.
mobs.desc: This guy does the SECOND HALF OF THE SKILLSETING the lesser imms wish they could do on their own.

mobs.long_desc: The Avatar of Ramah stands here.
mobs.desc: This guy does all the spellquest work the lesser imms wish they could do on there own.

objects.ground: A long handled dwarven axe is resting here.
A forging hammer is lying here.
A huge axe is leaning here, capable of work or battle as needed.

extras.text: This large axe would be very useful for cutting down trees or even battle. Its heavy bit would cut deep in wood or even armor.

objects.ground: A woodmen's axe is resting here.
A small clay healing potion has been dropped here.

extras.text: This small clay seems anti-climatic for a healing potion though quite suitable for a bandage.  It's doubtful that anything inside could save your life. Though it seems the only real way to find out what magic is contained in side would be to quaff it.

objects.ground: A small clay bottle is sitting here.
A badger pelt sewn into a cap lays here.
A cord with many teeth is lying here.
A heavy handcart is resting here.
An old pair of work gloves are lying here.
A red rubber ball sits here.
A long handled teardrop spear is lying here.
A locket is lying here in the dust.

extras.text: This locket is quite cheep like something you would expect to find in a child's jewelery   box but there must  be more then meets the eye. It must have been a gift from a powerful mage to his firstborn.

shops.no_such_item1: %s Sorry, I don't stock that item.
shops.no_such_item2: %s You don't seem to have that.
shops.do_not_buy: %s I don't trade in such items.

shops.no_such_item1: %s Sorry, I don't stock that item.
shops.no_such_item2: %s You don't seem to have that.
shops.do_not_buy: %s I don't trade in such items.

triggers.name: blacksmith quest
triggers.commands: wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Hello traveler, I was wondering if you had seen a dwarven msend %actor% &0boy heading this way?  My supplies are late, they should have been here a day msend %actor% &0ago.  Doren is never late, I wish i could go looking for him.  I fear something msend %actor% &0has happened to him, will you go find him?'

triggers.name: Helping_blacksmith_quest
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %get.mob_count[8712]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Thank you, thank you I will ever be in your debt if you msend %actor% &0find Doren.  He will be traveling here from the dwarven mines near Anduin.  If msend %actor% &0you find Doren tell him that his uncle sent you.  Please hurry!  He could be msend %actor% &0hurt or in trouble!' mat 55932 mload mob 8713 mat 55932 mload mob 8713 mat 55932 mload mob 8712 wait 1s mat 55932 mforce doren mload obj 8709 wait 1s mat 55932 mforce doren drop handcart else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Please go find Doren, he could be hurt.' endif

triggers.name: drag the handcart
triggers.commands: return 0 wait 1s if %arg% /= cart ||  %arg% /= wagon osend %actor% The handcart creaks along behind you. oechoaround %actor% The handcart creaks along behind %actor.name%. if %actor.room% == 8711 wait 1s oforce blacksmith blink %actor.name% oforce blacksmith emote rubs his eyes in disbelief. osend %actor.name% The blacksmith says, 'Oh it's you, you found the handcart, thank the gods!' wait 1s oforce blacksmith mload obj 8700 osend %actor.name% The blacksmith says, 'I must reward such heroism, and I know just the thing.' oforce blacksmith give axe %actor.name% oforce blacksmith emote moves the handcart into a bay near his tools. opurge %self% elseif %random.6% == 3 osend %actor% &2You hear a rustling in the grass nearby.&0 wait 1s oload mob 8713 oforce bandit kill %actor% oload mob 8713 oforce bandit kill %actor% endif endif

triggers.name: doren greet
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 wait 1s shout Help!  Help! mforce bandit kill %actor% wait 1s mecho &2A bandit flees from %actor.name% into the undergrowth.&0 mpurge 2.bandit wait 10s emote limps away from the bandit, blood running down his leg. wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Thank you for saving me.  I can make it home but I must go now. msend %actor% &0Please take the handcart to my uncle in the logging camp to the east.  He is msend %actor% &0the blacksmith there.  He will reward you for saving me and getting the msend %actor% &0handcart safely to him.' wait 2s mecho &2Doren limps though the grass heading for home. mpurge %self% endif

triggers.name: muleard_greet
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% turns around and looks at you. wait 1s tell %actor.name% Welcome to my store. wait 1s tell %actor.name% You can call me Mule. endif

triggers.name: ambush
triggers.commands: oecho checking.. if %random.10% < 2 oecho proc endif

triggers.name: anti-get trigger
triggers.commands: if %actor.size% == tiny || %actor.size% == small || %actor.size% == medium || %actor.size% == large || %actor.size% == huge return 0 odamage %actor% 50 crush if %damdone% != 0 osend %actor% Your back buckles and pain shoots though you joints! (&1&b%damdone%&0) osend %actor% You just can't hold that much weight! oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% shouts in pain. (&4%damdone%&0) osend %actor% You drop %self.shortdesc%. oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% drops %self.shortdesc%. else osend %actor% You can't seem to get a grip on %self.shortdesc%. endif endif

triggers.name: anti_thief_obj_trigger
triggers.commands: if %actor.class% /= thief return 0 osend %actor% You cannot use %self.shortdesc%. else return 1 endif

triggers.name: to_small_wield
triggers.commands: if %actor.size% == tiny || %actor.size% == small || %actor.size% == medium osend %actor% It's too big for you! return 0 else return 1 endif

triggers.name: white_mask_wear
triggers.commands: wait 1s osend %actor.name% As you place the white mask to your face, it starts to flow untill it conforms to your face. oechoaround %actor.name% a white mask flows like liquid as it conforms to %actor.name%'s face. return 1

triggers.name: Tr'ven (Speak fix)
triggers.commands: wait 10 say Yes i can fix just about anything that is broken or outdated. wait 5 say Lots of old Adventures have been bringing me items like ivory weddingbands. wait 5 say or Armor That they have Earned from there guilds and haveing me fix them up. wait 5 say to be as good as the items the would be rewarded with today. wait 5 say just hand me items and I'll get started

triggers.name: Tr'ven(greet)
triggers.commands: wait 1s if %actor.vnum% == -1 say Welcome to my shop. Is there something I can fix for you? endif

triggers.name: tr'ven(replace old items)
triggers.commands: if %object.vnum% => 1 set item %object.vnum% set name %object.shortdesc% wait 1s say %name%? mpurge %object% wait 1s say Yes, I think I can make %name% as good as new. mload obj %item% wait 1s msend %actor% &bThe air shudders as Tr'ven mutters a few words over %name%.&0 mechoaround %actor% The air shudders as Tr'ven mutters a few words over %name%. wait 1s emote holds up %name% and smiles at a job well done. wait 2s give all %actor% endif

triggers.name: skillset_skills_A-G
triggers.argument_list: skillset ready go cancel 2H backstab bandage barehand bash bludgeoning bodyslam chant conceal corner  disarm dodge doorbash double douse dual eye first group guard
triggers.commands: wait 1s if %skill% && %mortal% && %command% if %speech% == go && %actor.level% >= 101 mskillset %mortal% %skill% say Done. Did it work? elseif %speech% == cancel say Ok, lets start over, starting with the command.. endif unset command unset mortal unset skill elseif %skill% && %command% set mortal %actor.name% global mortal say Ok, imm, if you want to %command% %skill% to %mortal%, just say go! elseif %command% say Ok, I'll be %command%ing %speech%. say Mortal, if you are ready to get %speech%, say "ready". set skill %speech% global skill elseif %speech% == skillset set command mskillset global command say what skill will I be setting? endif

triggers.name: skillset_skills_H-V
triggers.argument_list: skillset ready go cancel hide hitall instant kick meditate  mount  pick parry piercing quick rescue  retreat riding safefall  scribe riposte shadow shape slashing sneak spell sphere springleap steal stealth summon switch tame throatcut track vamp
triggers.commands: wait 1s if %skill% && %mortal% && %command% if %speech% == go && %actor.level% >= 101 mskillset %mortal% %skill% say Done. Did it work? elseif %speech% == cancel say Ok, lets start over, starting with the command.. endif unset command unset mortal unset skill elseif %skill% && %command% set mortal %actor.name% global mortal say Ok, imm, if you want to %command% %skill% to %mortal%, just say go! elseif %command% say Ok, I'll be %command%ing %speech%. say Mortal, if you are ready to get %speech%, say "ready". set skill %speech% global skill elseif %speech% == skillset set command mskillset global command say what skill will I be setting? endif

triggers.name: skillset_questspells
triggers.argument_list: skillset ready go cancel banish blur charm creeping plane heavens dragons flood hell hellfire ice major relocate meteorswarm resurrect shift degeneration supernova wall vaporform word wizard aria seed apocalyptic group
triggers.commands: wait 1s if %skill% && %mortal% && %command% if %speech% == go && %actor.level% >= 101 mskillset %mortal% %skill% say Done. Did it work? elseif %speech% == cancel say Ok, lets start over, starting with the command.. endif unset command unset mortal unset skill elseif %skill% && %command% set mortal %actor.name% global mortal say Ok, imm, if you want to %command% %skill% to %mortal%, just say go! elseif %command% say Ok, I'll be %command%ing %speech%. say Mortal, if you are ready to get %speech%, say "ready". set skill %speech% global skill elseif %speech% == skillset set command mskillset global command say what skill will I be setting? endif

rooms.name: The Deeply Rutted Road
rooms.description: The road lay before you, though some may not characterize it as such.  Many wagons and animals have carved ruts deep into the Earth.  It's not quite wide enough for two carts to travel side by side.  A dense forest of tall dark trees flanks you on each side.

rooms.name: The Deeply Rutted Road
rooms.description: The road lay before you, though some may not characterize it as such.  Many wagons and animals have carved ruts deep into the Earth.  It's not quite wide enough for two carts to travel side by side.  A dense forest of tall dark trees flanks you on each side.

rooms.name: The Deeply Rutted Road
rooms.description: The road lay before you, though some may not characterize it as such.  Many wagons and animals have carved ruts deep into the Earth.  It's not quite wide enough for two carts to travel side by side.  A dense forest of tall dark trees flanks you on each side.

rooms.name: The Deeply Rutted Road
rooms.description: The road lay before you, though some may not characterize it as such.  Many wagons and animals have carved ruts deep into the Earth.  It's not quite wide enough for two carts to travel side by side.  Once there stood a forest that would have flanked you on each side and now only stumps of large trees shadow the road.

rooms.name: The Deeply Rutted Road
rooms.description: The road lay before you, though some may not characterize it as such.  Many wagons and animals have carved ruts deep into the Earth.  It's not quite wide enough for two carts to travel side by side.  Once there stood a forest that would have flanked you on each side.  The forest begins to widen a bit here, having been systematicly harvested.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Logging Camp
rooms.description: You are near the structures of the logging camp.  Much of the ground here is bare from the heavy traffic of men and animals.  Ox, mule, and horse tracks are clearly visible in the earth.  Off in the distance you hear the thudding of axes.  The stables are to the north of here to the west of them lay the general store.

rooms.name: Near the Logging Camp
rooms.description: You are near the structures of the logging camp.  Much of the ground here is bare from the heavy traffic of men and animals.  Ox, mule, and horse tracks are clearly visible in the earth.  Off in the distance you hear the thudding of axes.  To the northwest of here are the stables.

rooms.name: Near the Logging Camp
rooms.description: You are near the structures of the logging camp.  Much of the ground here is bare from the heavy traffic of men and animals.  Ox, mule, and horse tracks are clearly visible in the earth.  Off in the distance you hear the thudding of axes.  The stable is to the west of here and north of it lays the blacksmith's shop.

rooms.name: Near the Logging Camp
rooms.description: You are near the structures of the logging camp.  Much of the ground here is bare from the heavy traffic of men and animals.  Ox, mule, and horse tracks are clearly visible in the earth.  Off in the distance you hear the thudding of axes.  The blacksmith's shop is to the west of here and south of that lays the stables.

rooms.name: Near the Logging Camp
rooms.description: You are near the structures of the logging camp.  Much of the ground here is bare from the heavy traffic of men and animals.  Ox, mule, and horse tracks are clearly visible in the earth.  Off in the distance you hear the thudding of axes. To the southwest is the blacksmith's shop.

rooms.name: Near the Logging Camp
rooms.description: You are near the structures of the logging camp.  Much of the ground here is bare from the heavy traffic of men and animals.  Ox, mule, and horse tracks are clearly visible in the earth.  Off in the distance you hear the thudding of axes.  The blacksmith's shop is to the south of here and west of there is the barracks.

rooms.name: The Blacksmith's Shop
rooms.description: The structure itself is little more than a west and a south wall with a shabby slant roof.  The north and east walls are wide open to the lumberyard. Axeheads, wagon wheels and other metal tools are lieing disorganised all over the shop.  The smith's forge, anvil and barrel of tempering water are in the corner of the shop.  The embers are still hot, with a few unidentifiable pieces of steel red-hot, waiting to be worked.

rooms.name: The Barrics
rooms.description: This long room has many beds around it.  Most of them stacked three or more high some long others short.  But all having been painstakingly built of logs. There are paths between the rows of beds.  Wooden lockers cover all the walls except where the fire place is.  Which has a huge caldron of stew cooking.

rooms.name: The General Store
rooms.description: The walls in this room are log with a stone chimney in the north east corner.  You can hardly see the west wall muleard has so many things lining the shelves.  The north wall separates the store from the barracks which can be entered to the north to the south is the clearing

rooms.name: Near the Logging Camp
rooms.description: You are near the structures of the logging camp.  Much of the ground here is bare from the heavy traffic of men and animals.  Ox, mule, and horse tracks are clearly visible in the earth.  Off in the distance you hear the thudding of axes.  The general store is to the north of here to the east of it are the stables.

rooms.name: The Stables
rooms.description: This place smells of hard-working horses and mules.  Animals are kept here for needed rest and maintenance.  The floors need to be shoveled clear.  It must be a low priority task, considering all the men and boys in the lumber operation, and only one man assigned to house, feed, and maintain the stables of work animals.

rooms.name: back room of stable
rooms.description: You are in an unfinished room.

rooms.name: Fallen Trees Southeast of Camp
rooms.description: The workers swarm around this section of recently felled trees, removing Forest looms ominously to the south and east beyond this active work site. Camp is a Forest looms ominously to the south beyond this active work site. Camp is a short way to the Northwest.

rooms.name: Cleared Forest South of Camp
rooms.description: This is the south side of the logging operation.  The Black Forest continues off to the north too dense for passage.  Trails of broken branches and skidding tracks cover the ground heading west back to the road.  The black smoke rising from the logging camps blacksmith, as well as the log structures nearby is raising to the north.  All that stand between you and the camp is an expanse of cleared forest, stumps still intact.

rooms.name: Fallen Trees Southeast of Camp
rooms.description: The workers swarm around this section of recently felled trees, removing limbs and making logs ready for transportation back to the camp.  The Black Forest looms ominously to the south and east beyond this active work site. Camp is a shot way to the northwest.

rooms.name: Cleared Forest East of Camp
rooms.description: This is the east side of the logging operation.  The Black Forest continues off to the east too dense for passage.  Trails of broken branches and skidding tracks cover the ground heading back to the smoke you can see rising from the logging camps blacksmith, as well as the log structures nearby.  All that stand between you and the camp is an expanse of cleared forest, stumps still intact.

rooms.name: Cleared Forest North of Camp
rooms.description: This is the north side of the logging operation.  The Black Forest continues off to the north too dense for passage.  Trails of broken branches and skidding tracks cover the ground heading back to the smoke you can see rising from the logging camps blacksmith, as well as the log structures nearby.  All that stand between you and the camp is an expanse of cleared forest, stumps still intact.

rooms.name: On the Banks of a Stream
rooms.description: This river acts as a natural barrier for the logging operation.  It winds freely through the Black Forest, bending from the north toward the east in what is now a clearing in the woods.  The trees must have grown thick all the way to the bank, evidenced by the numberless tree-stumps left all around this man-made meadow.  The stream and continues forest prevent further travel to the north-west.  The logging camp is south-east from here.

rooms.name: On the Banks of a Stream
rooms.description: This river acts as a natural barrier for the logging operation.  It winds freely through the Black Forest, bending from the north toward the east in what is now a clearing in the woods.  The trees must have grown thick all the way to the bank, evidenced by the numberless tree-stumps left all around this man-made meadow.  The stream and continues forest prevent further travel to the north-west.  The logging camp is south-east from here.

rooms.name: Fallen Trees North of Camp
rooms.description: The workers swarm around this section of recently felled trees, removing limbs and making logs ready for transportation back to the camp.  The Black Forest looms ominously to the north beyond this active work site.  Camp is a short way to the south.

rooms.name: Fallen Trees North of Camp
rooms.description: The workers swarm around this section of recently felled trees, removing limbs and making logs ready for transportation back to the camp.  The Black Forest looms ominously to the north beyond this active work site.  Camp is a short way to the south.

rooms.name: Fallen Trees North of Camp
rooms.description: The workers swarm around this section of recently felled trees, removing limbs and making logs ready for transportation back to the camp.  The Black Forest looms ominously to the north beyond this active work site.  Camp is a short way to the south.

rooms.name: On the Banks of a Stream
rooms.description: The Black Forest has been cleared from the logging camp, south, to the banks of this river.  The river continues to be a natural border to the west, and continues on into the Black Forest toward the north.  To the east you can see the northern edge of the cleared section of woods.  All around you are light paths from workers and pack animals, weaving through countless tree-stumps.

rooms.name: On the Banks of a Stream
rooms.description: This river acts as a natural barrier for the logging operation.  It winds freely through the Black Forest, bending from the north toward the east in what is now a clearing in the woods.  The trees must have grown thick all the way to the bank, evidenced by the numberless tree-stumps left all around this man-made meadow.  The stream and continues forest prevent further travel to the north-west.  The logging camp is south-east from here.

rooms.name: Cleared Forest West of Camp
rooms.description: This is the west side of the logging operation.  The Black Forest continues off to the west too dense for passage.  Trails of broken branches and skidding tracks cover the ground you can see smoke rising from the logging camps blacksmith, as well as the log structures nearby.  All that stand between you and the camp is an expanse of cleared forest, stumps still intact.

rooms.name: Cleared Forest West of Camp
rooms.description: This is the west side of the logging operation.  The Black Forest continues off to the west too dense for passage.  Trails of broken branches and skidding tracks cover the ground you can see smoke rising from the logging camps blacksmith, as well as the log structures nearby.  All that stand between you and the camp is an expanse of cleared forest, stumps still intact.

rooms.name: Cleared Forest West of Camp
rooms.description: This is the west side of the logging operation.  The Black Forest continues off to the west too dense for passage.  Trails of broken branches and skidding tracks cover the ground you can see smoke rising from the logging camps blacksmith, as well as the log structures nearby.  All that stand between you and the camp is an expanse of cleared forest, stumps still intact.

rooms.name: Fallen Trees Southwest of Camp
rooms.description: The workers swarm around this section of recently felled trees, removing limbs and making logs ready for transportation back to the camp.  The Black Forest looms ominously to the south and west beyond this active work site.  Camp is a short way to the northeast.

rooms.name: On the Banks of a Stream
rooms.description: This river acts as a natural barrier for the logging operation.  It winds freely through the Black Forest, bending from the north toward the east in what is now a clearing in the woods.  The trees must have grown thick all the way to the bank, evidenced by the numberless tree-stumps left all around this man-made meadow.  The stream and continues forest prevent further travel to the north-west.  The logging camp is south-east from here.

rooms.name: On the Banks of a Stream
rooms.description: This river acts as a natural barrier for the logging operation.  It winds freely through the Black Forest, bending from the north toward the east in what is now a clearing in the woods.  The trees must have grown thick all the way to the bank, evidenced by the numberless tree-stumps left all around this man-made meadow.  The stream and continues forest prevent further travel to the north-west.  The logging camp is south-east from here.

rooms.name: Cleared Forest West of Camp
rooms.description: This is the west side of the logging operation.  The Black Forest continues off to the west too dense for passage.  Trails of broken branches and skidding tracks cover the ground you can see smoke rising from the logging camps blacksmith, as well as the log structures nearby.  All that stand between you and the camp is an expanse of cleared forest, stumps still intact.

rooms.name: Fallen Trees Southwest of Camp
rooms.description: The workers swarm around this section of recently felled trees, removing limbs and making logs ready for transportation back to the camp.  The Black Forest looms ominously to the south and west beyond this active work site.  Camp is a short way to the northeast.

rooms.name: On the Banks of a Stream
rooms.description: The Black Forest has been cleared from the logging camp, east, to the banks of this river.  The river continues to be a natural border to the north, and continues on into the Black Forest toward the west.  To the south you can see the western edge of the cleared section of woods.  All around you are light paths from workers and pack animals, weaving through countless tree-stumps.

rooms.name: Fallen Trees West of Camp
rooms.description: The workers swarm around this section of recently felled trees, removing limbs and making logs ready for transportation back to the camp.  The Black Forest looms ominously to the west beyond this active work site.  Camp is a short way to the east.

rooms.name: Cleared Forest South of Camp
rooms.description: This is the south side of the logging operation.  The Black Forest continues off to the north too dense for passage.  Trails of broken branches and skidding tracks cover the ground heading east back to the road.  The black smoke rising from the logging camps blacksmith, as well as the log structures nearby is raising to the north.  All that stand between you and the camp is an expanse of cleared forest, stumps still intact.

rooms.name: Near the Logging Camp
rooms.description: You are near the structures of the logging camp.  Much of the ground here is bare from the heavy traffic of men and animals.  Ox, mule, and horse tracks are clearly visible in the earth.  Off in the distance you hear the thudding of axes.  To the northeast of here is the general store.

rooms.name: Near the Logging Camp

Ox, mule, and horse tracks are clearly visible in the earth.  Off in the distance you hear the thudding of axes.  The long log wall of the barracks and general store is east of here.

Ox, mule, and horse tracks are clearly visible in the earth.  Off in the distance you hear the thudding of axes.  The barracks is to the south of here and east of there is the blacksmith's shop
